question: 1a. Indicate the studyâ€™s design as cross-sectional, cohort or case-control in the title or the abstract
1b_i. Provide in the abstract an informative and balanced summary of what was done
1b_ii. Provide in the abstract an informative and balanced summary of what was found
2_i. Explain the scientific background for the investigation being reported
2_ii. Explain the rationale for the investigation being reported
3. State specific objectives, including any prespecified hypotheses
4. Present key elements of study design early in the paper
5_i. Describe the setting
5_ii. Describe the locations
5_iii. Describe the relevant dates including periods of recruitment
5_iv.  Describe the relevant dates including periods of exposure
5_v. Describe the relevant dates including periods of follow-up
5_vi. Describe the relevant dates including periods of data collection
6a_i_coh_cs. Cross-sectional and cohort studies - Give the eligibility criteria
6a_ii_coh_cs. Cross-sectional and cohort studies - Give the sources of participants
6a_iii_coh_cs. Cross-sectional and cohort studies - Give the methods of selection of participants
6a_iv_coh. Cohort study - Describe methods of follow-up
6b_i_coh. Cohort study - For matched studies, give matching criteria
6b_ii_coh. Cohort study - For matched studies, give number of exposed and unexposed
6a_i_cc. Case-control study - Give the eligibility criteria
6a_ii_cc. Case-control study - Give the sources of case ascertainment and control selection
6a_iii_cc. Case-control study - Give the methods of case ascertainment and control selection.
6a_iv_cc. Case-control study - Give the rationale for the choice of cases and controls
6b_i_cc. Case-control study - For matched studies, give matching criteria
6b_ii_cc. Case-control study - For matched studies, give the number of controls per case
7_i. Clearly define all outcomes
bar_label: Define outcomes, exposures, confounders, modifiers & diagnosis

question: 7_ii. Clearly define all exposures
bar_label: Define outcomes, exposures, confounders, modifiers & diagnosis

question: 7_iii. Clearly define all predictors
bar_label: Define outcomes, exposures, confounders, modifiers & diagnosis

question: 7_iv. Clearly define all  potential confounders
bar_label: Define outcomes, exposures, confounders, modifiers & diagnosis

question: 7_v. Clearly define all effect modifiers
bar_label: Define outcomes, exposures, confounders, modifiers & diagnosis

question: 7_vi. Give diagnostic criteria, if applicable
bar_label: Define outcomes, exposures, confounders, modifiers & diagnosis

question: 8starred_i. For each variable of interest, give sources of data
8starred_ii. For each variable of interest, give details of methods of assessment (measurement)
8starred_iii. Describe comparability of assessment methods if there is more than one group
9. Describe any efforts to address potential sources of bias (this does not include  any adjustment for confounders)
10. Explain how the study size was arrived at
11_i. Explain how quantitative variables were handled in the analyses
11_ii. If applicable, describe which groupings were chosen
11_iii. If applicable, describe why groupings were chosen
12a. Describe all statistical methods, including those used to control for confounding
12b_i. Describe any methods used to examine subgroups
12b_ii. Describe any methods used to examine interactions
12c. Explain how missing data were addressed
12d_coh. Cohort study - If applicable, explain how loss to follow-up was addressed
bar_label: Address loss to follow-up/explain matching/account for sampling

question: 12d_cc. Case-control study-If applicable, explain how matching of cases and controls was addressed
bar_label: Address loss to follow-up/explain matching/account for sampling

question: 12d_cs. Cross-sectional study-If applicable, describe analytical methods taking account of sampling strategy
bar_label: Address loss to follow-up/explain matching/account for sampling

question: 12e. Describe any sensitivity analyses

13starreda. Report numbers of individuals at each stage of the present study-eg numbers potentially eligible, examined for eligibility, confirmed eligible, included in the study, completing follow-up, and analysed
13starredb. Give reasons for non-participation at each stage of the present study
13starredc. Use a flow diagram if appropriate
14starreda_i. Give characteristics of study participants (eg demographic, clinical, social)
14starreda_ii. Give information on exposures and potential confounders
14starredb. Indicate number of participants with missing data for each variable of interest
14starredc_coh. Cohort study - Summarise follow-up time (eg, average and total amount)
15starred_coh. Cohort study-Report numbers of outcome events or summary measures over time
15starred_cc. Case-control study-Report numbers in each exposure category, or summary measures of exposure
15starred_cs. Cross-sectional study-Report numbers of outcome events or summary measures
16a_i. Give unadjusted estimates
bar_label: Give unadjusted & adjusted estimates. Define & justify confounders

question: 16a_ii. If applicable, give confounder-adjusted estimates
bar_label: Give unadjusted & adjusted estimates. Define & justify confounders

question: 16a_iii. If applicable, give the confounder-adjusted estimates' precision (eg, 95% confidence interval)
bar_label: Give unadjusted & adjusted estimates. Define & justify confounders

question: 16a_iv. Make clear which confounders were adjusted for
bar_label: Give unadjusted & adjusted estimates. Define & justify confounders

question: 16a_v. Make clear why confounders were included
bar_label: Give unadjusted & adjusted estimates. Define & justify confounders

question: 16b. Report category boundaries when continuous variables were categorized
16c. If relevant, consider translating estimates of relative risk into absolute risk for a meaningful time period
17_i. Report analyses of subgroups
bar_label: Report subgroup, interaction, sensitivity & other analyses

question: 17_ii. Report analyses interactions
bar_label: Report subgroup, interaction, sensitivity & other analyses

question: 17_iii. Report sensitivity analyses
bar_label: Report subgroup, interaction, sensitivity & other analyses

question: 17_iv. Report other analyses done
bar_label: Report subgroup, interaction, sensitivity & other analyses

question: 18. Summarise key results with reference to study objectives
19_i. Discuss limitations of the study, taking into account sources of potential bias or imprecision
19_ii. Discuss both direction and magnitude of any potential bias
20. Give a cautious overall interpretation of results considering objectives, limitations, multiplicity of analyses, results from similar studies, and other relevant evidence
21. Discuss the generalisability (external validity) of the study results

bar_label: Authors' & UK Biobank funders & their role
